2. If we succeed well in this part of our Art,
it will make our work more remarkably beautiful,
As with the maiden Glycera of Sicyone,
seller of flower garlands, who knew how to arrange
her Flowers ten thousand ways
with an extraordinary sense of their nature,
particularly cheerful colors, which so delighted
the Painter Pausias that he fell in love with her.

3. Let us vary our Fabrics in the same manner,
for Pausias, seeing this this artful arrangement,
began to paint her Bouquets and Crowns
and became fully skilled in these matters.
At last he toiled much further,
and with great pleasure made a portrait of her
assembling her Crowns.
This piece was called Stephanoplokos.

4. And so, in regard to varying colors,
we have proposed a discourse of Flowers,
which are painted in variety by nature,
in fragrant Spring, in the valleys of Tempe,
as if scattered on a green Carpet.
And however many thousands of flowers are opened,
scarcely one of them will still be green.
This occurs because of variation,
left-middleLearn from Flowers how to vary colors.

5. yet varying from green to green, even with each
standing out, will lead to beauty.
Whether red, blue, purple, or white as milk,
Look also at the leaves of Trees and shrubs, which,
though themselves all green, have great variation.
Now, lifting our eyes from these meadows,
we see a variation that ought to be noticed
day and night, in the vaulted Sky.
left-middleThe variation, or dividing, of colors, to observe in all living things.

6. I let the blushing dawn,
the herald of Phoebus, pass by,
with her splendid variety, early and late;
but to see beyond (it is worth observing)
how the golden Sun, illuminating all the World,
brings in and leads away the Years
in a blue field of azure; and how the Moon and Stars,
his Vassals, shine in the blue as brightly as gold!

7. Yellow and blue go well side by side;
you might color your fabrics this way.
Red and green, too, love each other wonderfully.
Red next to blue, to make a change,
are also well suited; purple has no fear
of being near yellow, green is refreshed
next to whiteâ€“indeed, white fits with all colors,
just as Vines go well with fields of Wheat.

8. That Nature shows us how to create variety
is easily seen in all things
which offer joyful embellishment to the eyes.
For example, talkative Parrots,
birds, shells, and still more creatures,
show how all colors agree with one another.
Thus Nature, which makes us all wise,
left-middleNature shows us how to create variation in colors.
